cell_variable_type.description: Mass-related variables, including those representing thermodynamic and hydrodynamic quantities.

description: Mass variables on a regular latitude-longitude grid.

horizontal_grid_cells.description: Global regular latitude-longitude grid with 1.25° x 0.9° resolution and 55296 cells.

grid_mapping.description: A projection that treats latitude and longitude as planar X and Y coordinates, as defined by the CF conventions.

grid_type.description: A rectilinear latitude-longitude grid with evenly spaced latitude points and evenly spaced longitude points.

region.description: The complete Earth surface, 90 degrees North to 90 degrees South latitude, and all longitudes.

temporal_refinement.description: Grid resolution remains constant throughout the simulation.

units.description: Angular measurement in degrees for latitude/longitude coordinates.

cell_variable_type.description: Mass-related variables, including those representing thermodynamic and hydrodynamic quantities.

description: Mass variables on a linear spectral Gaussian grid (TL127).

horizontal_grid_cells.description: Linear spectral Gaussian grid (TL127) with 24572 cells.

grid_mapping.description: A projection that treats latitude and longitude as planar X and Y coordinates, as defined by the CF conventions.

grid_type.description: A spectral Gaussian grid for which the smallest spectral wavelength is represented by 2 grid points.

region.description: The complete Earth surface, 90 degrees North to 90 degrees South latitude, and all longitudes.

temporal_refinement.description: Grid resolution remains constant throughout the simulation.

truncation_method.description: Triangular truncation in spectral space where total wavenumber m+n ≤ N. Common notation: TL (triangular linear) or TQ (triangular quadratic).

units.description: Angular measurement in degrees for latitude/longitude coordinates.

cell_variable_type.description: Mass-related variables, including those representing thermodynamic and hydrodynamic quantities.

description: Mass variables on an ocean tripolar grid (eORCA1).

grid_mapping.description: A projection that treats latitude and longitude as planar X and Y coordinates, as defined by the CF conventions.

grid_type.description: A global curvilinear ocean grid with a southern pole and two northern poles all placed over land.

region.description: The complete Earth surface, 90 degrees North to 90 degrees South latitude, and all longitudes.

temporal_refinement.description: Grid resolution remains constant throughout the simulation.

cell_variable_type.description: Mass-related variables, including those representing thermodynamic and hydrodynamic quantities.

Variables representing the X component of the velocity vector and certain horizontal fluxes of mass, energy, momentum, etc. For a grid defined by spherical polar coordinates, the X direction is longitude.

Variables representing the Y component of the velocity vector and certain horizontal fluxes of mass, energy, momentum, etc. For a grid defined by spherical polar coordinates, the Y direction is latitude.

description: Mass and velocity variables on an adaptive polar stereographic mesh for ice sheets.

horizontal_grid_cells.description: Adaptive polar stereographic mesh for ice sheets with variable resolution (9.6 km to 1.2 km for Greenland, 8 km to 2 km for Antarctica).

grid_mapping.description: An azimuthal projection that maps the Earth's surface onto a flat plane from a view point at one pole, projecting points from the globe to a plane tangent to the opposite pole, as defined by the CF conventions.

grid_type.description: Any transformation employed to represent the spherical surface of the globe on a plane.

region.description: Located in the Northern Atlantic Ocean, separated from other land masses by the Labrador Sea and Straits, and almost entirely north of 60 degrees North latitude.
Located around the South Pole, separated from other land masses by the Southern Ocean, and almost entirely south of 60 degrees South latitude.

temporal_refinement.description: Grid resolution changes dynamically during the simulation based on solution features.

cell_variable_type.description: Mass-related variables, including those representing thermodynamic and hydrodynamic quantities.

description: Mass variables on a regular latitude-longitude grid for land surface modelling.

horizontal_grid_cells.description: Global regular latitude-longitude grid with 1.25° x 0.9° resolution and 55296 cells, offset origin from g100.

grid_mapping.description: A projection that treats latitude and longitude as planar X and Y coordinates, as defined by the CF conventions.

grid_type.description: A rectilinear latitude-longitude grid with evenly spaced latitude points and evenly spaced longitude points.

region.description: The complete Earth surface, 90 degrees North to 90 degrees South latitude, and all longitudes.

temporal_refinement.description: Grid resolution remains constant throughout the simulation.

units.description: Angular measurement in degrees for latitude/longitude coordinates.
